hypothesis_content.title: Pre-Volatility-Event Gamma Squeeze Setup
hypothesis_content.statement: In the 24-36 hours preceding a scheduled high-volatility event (e.g., FOMC, CPI, Options Expiry), if BTC's 25-delta option skew flattens or inverts (Call IV - Put IV < 1%) while spot price is pinned within a 1% range of a large gamma neutral zone (e.g., a major options strike), a breakout from this pinning range will occur within 4 hours after the event conclusion, with an 85% probability of moving in the direction of the initial 1-hour post-event move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Market makers hedge options by buying/selling spot, pinning price near large gamma strikes. Flattened skew indicates balanced positioning and suppressed volatility. This creates a 'coiled spring' effect. The scheduled event acts as a catalyst, forcing a violent repricing and a breakout from the artificially suppressed range as hedging dynamics shift dramatically.
entry_conditions: Scheduled high-volatility event within next 36 hours (pre-defined calendar)
25-delta BTC option skew (1-month) < 1% absolute value for 12 consecutive hours
Spot price trades within +/- 0.5% of a major gamma neutral strike (e.g., largest open interest strike) for > 18 hours
Enter a long straddle/strangle (or defined-risk volatility position) 2 hours BEFORE the scheduled event

exit_conditions.take_profit: Close position 4 hours AFTER the event if implied volatility has spiked > 25% from entry level OR spot price has moved > 3% from the pinning strike
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Time-based: Close position at event time if no volatility compression/pinning was present (skew > 1% or price not pinned).
exit_conditions.time_exit: 6 hours after event start if TP not met

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 15% of such pre-event pinning/compression setups result in a 'dud' event with volatility remaining suppressed and price continuing to chop, failing to generate a directional move post-event. This would indicate the event was fully priced in or irrelevant.
